summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, providing the password for a drive containing discovery materials related to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed the letter transmitting the password for discovery materials.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) Legal Department, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password for a drive containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell, inmate number 02879-509.
The letter is addressed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, where Maxwell was likely held.
The correspondence indicates an ongoing legal process involving the transfer of discovery materials to the defense or detention facility.
